steps.title: Goated with the sauce means someone is great in various ways.
steps.content: Goated with the sauce means someone is great in various ways. The first half of the phrase, " goated ," means someone is "the greatest of all time," or the "G.O.A.T." [1] X Research source The second half of the phrase, "sauce," typically refers to swagger, designer clothes and accessories, or confidence, depending on the context it's used in. [2] X Research source When put together, "goated with the sauce" means someone is the greatest of all time and has lots of confidence and swagger. The phrase is primarily used to jokingly hype up someoneâ€™s appearance. For example, memes of people like Bill Gates and Machine Gun Kelly may be captioned â€œgoated with the sauce.â€

steps.title: â€œQuirked up white boy goated with the sauce.â€

You can also use the phrase to genuinely praise a person, although this is more common in personal social media comments or over text. The meaning depends on the context it is used in. For example: [3] X Research source Your Friend: â€œDid you see Jack Harlowâ€™s new Instagram post? Heâ€™s got so much sauce.â€ You: â€œFr!! Heâ€™s a quirked up white boy goated with the sauce ğŸ¤«â€ Example: â€œYou saw the meme of that rapper Riff Raff on TikTok? He was the first quirked up white boy goated with the sauce.â€

It is primarily used as an absurd, humorous way to describe a white guy as well-dressed, confident, and great, even if they seem average on the surface. [4] X Research source Example: â€œDang bro, I didnâ€™t know you had swag like that. Mr. quirked up white boy goated with the sauce is over here busting it down sexual style.â€ This variation of the phrase was used in the original tweet that birthed â€œgoated with the sauce.â€

steps.title: People use goated with the sauce to humorously hype someone up.
steps.content: People use goated with the sauce to humorously hype someone up. Online, the phrase is primarily used in humorous memes and comments to hype someone up, whether they know the person or not. For example, on January 28, 2022, X user @notgxku posted a photo of actor Evan Peters with the caption â€œquirked up white boy who busts it down sexual style, some might say goated with the sauce.â€ Despite primarily being used online, the phrase can also be used in person. [5] X Research source Example: â€œMan, the way he puts a fit together and poses is so tuff. Heâ€™s goated with the sauce.â€ Example: Your Friend: â€œDid you see that picture of Macaulay Culkin on TikTok? Dudeâ€™s goated with the sauceâ€ You: â€œBro it was just a regular pic of him ğŸ˜‚â€ You can also use the phrase "goated with the sauce" to hype yourself up. For example, you can post a photo of yourself with the caption â€œWait, I think Iâ€™m goated with the sauce.â€

steps.title: The phrase originated from an X meme posted in 2021.
steps.content: The phrase originated from an X meme posted in 2021. In December 2021, X user @minga__ made a post on the app captioned â€œquirked up white boy with a little bit of swag busts it down sexual styleâ€¦is he goated with the sauce?â€ The post quickly went viral on the app, spawning reposts, remakes, and reiterations throughout X, Instagram, TikTok, and other social media platforms. [6] X Research source For example, on December 28, 2021, X user @jetski0 said in a post that David Lynchâ€™s Twin Peaks character was goated with the sauce. The meme spread to TikTok in January 2022 when @dillvveed made a post with a parodied Breaking News segment talking about a "quirked up white boy busting it down sexual style gone wrong."

steps.title: People use "sauce" to refer to swagger because it adds zest and flavor.
steps.content: People use "sauce" to refer to swagger because it adds zest and flavor. The use of "sauce" to describe something thatâ€™s luxurious or full of swagger has been popular since at least 2013. Although the origin of the relationship between swagger and sauce isnâ€™t confirmed, itâ€™s speculated that people call it sauce because sauce is something that adds zest or a delicious flavor to foods, much like designer goods and swagger add "flavor" to someone's style. [7] X Research source

For example, someone who is starting to feel better after dealing with a bout of seasonal depression would say â€œwait, Iâ€™m goatedâ€ when their mood starts to improve. [8] X Research source

For example, someone who is constantly confused at work and doesnâ€™t know what to do to succeed at their job would be considered lost in the sauce. [9] X Research source
